p.s: In the following I want to analyze in what way this excerpt can be considered the turning point of the play and which previous events and conflicts finally lead to Amir's emotional outburst.
The excerpt can be considered the turning point because it makes clear that Islam is still part of Amir.
He spits in Isaac's face (p. 72, l. 40).
The author wants to point out that after all this time, in which Amir tried to give up his religion, the influence his mother had, when he was a child, still has an impact on him.
When Amir was a child his mother spat in his face, when he told her that he likes ana jewishJewish girl.
When Amir saw this girl again he spat in her face too.
A further point is that Amir hit Emily multiple times in the face (comparcompare p. 74, ll. 5-14).

In an earlier scene Amir tells Emily, Jory and Isaac that the KoranQuran says: Men are in charge of woman... if they don't obey... talk to them.If that [does not] work... [Do not] sleep with them.And if that [does not] work beat them (p. 64, ll. 12-18).
The author again wants to tell us that the Islam still has an impact on Amir.
But not only the fact that Emily has an affair with Isaac leadleads to Amir's emotional outburst.
Emily couldn't understand why Amir wantwants to give up his religion.
She could not understand why Amir does not want to be seen with the Iman.
They always discussed about this topic.
Amir followed the order how to deal with womanwomen, who doesdo not obey, probably deliberate.
First he talked with Emily, secondly he did not sleep with her and at the end he hit Emily in her face.
Another conflict that leadleads to his outburst is the promotion he did not get because the media made him look like the attorney of ana terrorist.
Emily convinced him to go to the hearing.
This made his office check his document.
He thinks this is also the reason why Jory was promoted.
In the given excerpt the author also points out that Amir was angry with Jory about not telling him about her promotion (p. 71, ll. 23-25).
To sum it up the anger and disappointment pent up for quite a while and the affair between Emily and Isaac only was a final trigger for Amir's emotional outburst.
